modules.pv_api package¶

Submodules¶

modules.pv_api.Chemputer_Device_API module¶

:mod:”Chemputer_Device_API” – API for Chemputer pumps and valves¶

This API is intended for controlling a set of Chemputer pumps and valves over a local network.

class modules.pv_api.Chemputer_Device_API.ChemputerDevice(address, name='')[source]¶

Bases: object

API for interfacing with the Chemputer pumps and valves.

Parameters

  • address (str) – Address of the device

  • name (str) – Optional name of the device

High-level method to assign a new IP to a device. Constructs a standard MAC from the provided IP and sends over the entire network config.

Parameters

ip_address (str) – new IP Address of the device

construct_network_config(mac_address, ip_address, subnet_mask, gateway_ip, dns_server_ip, DHCP_mode)[source]¶

Constructs the network configuration Parses the addresses and joining them into a string of numbers that represent the addresses

Parameters

  • mac_address (str) – MAC address of the device

  • ip_address (str) – IP address of the device

  • subnet_mask (str) – Address f the subnet mask of the network

  • gateway_ip (str) – Address of the default gateway of the network

  • dns_server_ip (str) – Address of the DNS server

  • DHCP_mode (int) – Flag for determining if the device should use static IP allocation (1) or the DHCP allocation (2).

Returns

String representing all the addresses as individual numbers

Return type

cfg_string (str)

construct_network_config_string(cfg_list)[source]¶

Creates the network configuration string from a list of addresses created via convert_network_address_to_list

Parameters

cfg_list (List) – List of lists containing all the addresses

Returns

String containing the numbers of the addresses

Return type

cfg_string (str)

construct_pump_config(config_dict=None)[source]¶

Constructs a pump configuration Takes a normal (unordered) dictionary with human-readable parameters (e.g. 256 microsteps rather than microsteps = 0) and constructs an ordered dict containing all values that need to be sent to the pump in their proper order. The process involves three steps: first, the microstep value, the motor profile, number of steps per mL and for the entire syringe are worked out based on the information provided, and stored in the PUMP_CONFIG dict. Then all keys that have not yet been populated are just transferred over. Third, the new dict is ordered by iterating over the key list and sending each item to the end.

Parameters

config_dict (dict) – dictionary containing all necessary information to configure a pump

Returns

ordered dictionary ready to be sent to the pump

Return type

PUMP_CONFIG (ordereddict)

construct_valve_config(config_dict=None)[source]¶

Constructs a valve configuration

Parameters

config_dict (dict) – dictionary containing all necessary information to configure a valve

Returns

ordered dictionary ready to be sent to the valve

Return type

VALVE_CONFIG (ordereddict)

convert_list_to_address(addr_list, mac=False)[source]¶

Converts a list into an address Will also convert the decimal mac address into the appropriate hex format

Parameters

  • addr_list (List) – List containing the elements of the address

  • mac (bool) – Flag for determining if the address is a mac address

Returns

The string representation of the address

Return type

addr (str)

convert_network_address_to_list(address, split_delimiter)[source]¶

Converts a network address to a python list Splits the address based off of a delimiter and adds the elements as string to a list

Parameters

  • address (str) – Address to convert

  • split_delimiter (str) – Delimiting character used to split the address (“.” for IP addresses, “:” for MAC Addresses)

Returns

List of strings containing the values of the address minus the delimiting character

Return type

addr_split (List)

  • cfg_type (str) – Type of configuration to parse into (Pump/Valve/Network)

Parses the network configuration string for the relevant information Hardcoded values should not change but a fix will be implemented to make it a bit more robust

Parameters

cfg_string (str) – String representing the network information

Returns

Ordered Dictionary containing all the network information

Return type

read_device_configuration()[source]¶

Reads the device configuration from the server and displays it back to the user

read_errors()[source]¶

Reads error flags from the server

read_network_configuration()[source]¶

Reads the network configuration for the device from the server and displays it back to the user

receive_response()[source]¶

Received the response from the server and prints out the response to screen. Specific cases are present for reading configurations (device/network) and for checking the completion flag.

send_and_wait_reply(msg)[source]¶

Debug method for sending arbitrary strings to the server.

Parameters

msg (str) – Message to send

send_command(*cmds)[source]¶

Constructs the command string and sends it to the TCP server.

Parameters

cmds (Variadic) – List of commands used to create the string.

wait_until_ready()[source]¶

Waits until the device is ready by listening for a DONE command from the server. This then sets the flag that the operation has completed.

write_network_configuration(mac_address, ip_address, subnet_mask, gateway_ip, dns_server_ip, DHCP_mode=1)[source]¶

Creates the network configuration for the device and sends it to the server.

Parameters

  • mac_address (str) – MAC address of the device

  • ip_address (str) – IP Address of the device

  • subnet_mask (str) – Address of the subnet mask of the network

  • gateway_ip (str) – Address of the default gateway of the network

  • dns_server_ip (str) – Address of the DNS server

  • DHCP_mode (int) – Flag for determining if the device should use static IP allocation (1) or the DHCP allocation (2). Default is 1

hard_home(speed_in_milliliters_per_min=50)[source]¶

Finds the home position by stalling the plunger against the base, then backing up a number of steps.

Parameters

speed_in_milliliters_per_min (int) – Speed to move in milliliters per minute

Broadcasts the UDP keepalive signal to ensure the board is still alive

Parameters
